Automation.description: Toggles server member greeting messages on/off on the server.
Automation.name: greet

Automation.description: Sets the text channel where server greeting messages are going to be sent by the bot.
Automation.help: By default, these messages are sent to **#general**. If no text channel exists with that name, it uses the first text channel on the list.
Automation.name: greet setchannel

Automation.description: Resets the server greeting messages text channel back to default.
Automation.name: greet setchannel default

Automation.description: Disables server member greeting messages on the server.
Automation.name: greet disable

Automation.description: Enables server member greetings on the server. Instead of a text channel on your server, future messages will instead be sent directly to users' direct messages.
Automation.name: greet dm

Automation.description: Command to test your custom server member greetings message.
Automation.name: greet test

Automation.description: Changes the greeting message to a custom one. Feel free to check the notes to be able to fully utilize this command.
Automation.name: greet message

Automation.description: Resets the server greeting message back to default.
Automation.name: greet message default

Automation.description: Enables server member greeting messages on the server.
Automation.name: greet enable

Automation.description: Toggles server member goodbye messages on/off on the server.
Automation.name: bye

Automation.description: Disables server member goodbye messages on the server.
Automation.name: bye disable

Automation.description: Command to test your custom server goodbye message.
Automation.name: bye test

Automation.description: Enables server member goodbye messages on the server.
Automation.name: bye enable

Automation.description: Changes the goodbye message to a custom one. Feel free to check the notes to be able to fully utilize this command.
Automation.name: bye message

Automation.description: Resets the server member goodbye message back to default.
Automation.name: bye message default

Automation.description: Sets the text channel where server goodbye messages are going to be sent by the bot.
Automation.help: By default, these messages are sent to **#general**. If no text channel exists with that name, it uses the first text channel on the list.
Automation.name: bye setchannel

Automation.description: Resets the server goodbye messages text channel back to default.
Automation.name: bye setchannel default

Conquest.description: Creates a settlement.
Conquest.help: This command requires three arguments - settlement name (should be in quotes), settlement type (either *public* or *private) and entry fee (minimum 100)
Conquest.name: screate

Conquest.description: Displays a settlement's public information.
Conquest.help: This command has one optional argument - the target individual. If no argument is parsed then the command will display the settlement you currectly reside in.
Conquest.name: sinfo

Conquest.description: A help command that shows information about the type of settlements based on access.
Conquest.name: join

Conquest.description: Command to join a public settlement.
Conquest.name: join public

Conquest.description: Command to join a private settlement.
Conquest.name: join private

Conquest.description: A command group. If no subcommands are invoked by the user, this command will display your settlement's invide code.
Conquest.name: code

Conquest.description: Displays your settlement's invite code. The code is sent privately to the author.
Conquest.help: This command can also be used directly in the bot's direct messages.
Conquest.name: code show

Conquest.description: Generates a new invite code for your settlement.
Conquest.help: This command can also be used directly in the bot's direct messages.
Conquest.name: code new

Conquest.description: Attacks the target individual's settlement.
Conquest.name: attack

Conquest.description: Returns the settlements' leaderboard
Conquest.help: This command takes one optional argument - the page number. If no argument is passed, then it defaults to 1.
Conquest.name: sleaderboard

Conquest.description: Leave the settlement you are currently in.
Conquest.help:
- Leaders of settlements with multiple residents cannot leave settlement without transferring ownership.
- Settlements with only one resident will get **DESTROYED** in the process!
Conquest.name: sleave

Conquest.description: Promotes the target individual to settlement leader.
Conquest.help: This command can **ONLY** be used by settlement leaders.
Conquest.name: promote

Conquest.description: Kicks the target individual from the settlement.
Conquest.help: This command can **ONLY** be used by settlement leaders.
Conquest.name: skick

Conquest.description: Displays the amount of resources currently stored in your settlement.
Conquest.name: resources

Conquest.description: A command group. If no subcommands are invoked by the user, this command will display the buildings' status of the settlement you are part of. (if any)
Conquest.name: buildings

Conquest.description:
Upgrades the target settlement building to the next level.
Buildings can be upgraded to Level 10.
Conquest.help: This command can **ONLY** be used by settlement leaders.
Conquest.name: buildings upgrade

Conquest.description: Displays the buildings' status of the settlement you are part of. (if any)
Conquest.name: buildings list

Conquest.description: Displays the buildings' status of the settlement you are part of. (if any)
Conquest.name: buildings compact

Conquest.description: Displays target settlement building upgrade requirements for every level from 1 to 10.
Conquest.name: requirements

Conquest.description: A command group. If no subcommands are invoked by the user, this command will display the resource market.
Conquest.help: This command can also be used directly in the bot's direct messages.
Conquest.name: market

Conquest.description: Sells a set amount of resources on the market.
Conquest.help: This command can **ONLY** be used by settlement leaders.
Conquest.name: market sell

Conquest.description: Buys a set amount of resources from the market.
Conquest.help: This command can **ONLY** be used by settlement leaders.
Conquest.name: market buy

Conquest.description: Deposits a sum of money into the treasury of the settlement you are currently part of.
Conquest.help: You need to be part of a settlement to be able to use this command.
Conquest.name: deposit

Conquest.description: Renames your settlement to the given name.
Conquest.help:
- You must be the leader of this settlement to be able to use this command.
- In order to rename your settlement, you need to pay a fee of 500 gold.
- Settlement names have a character limit of 50 characters.
Conquest.name: srename

Conquest.description: Force renames the target settlement to the provided input.
Conquest.name: srename force

Conquest.description: Converts the settlement access type to public/private for your settlement.
Conquest.help: You must be the leader of this settlement to be able to use this command.
Conquest.name: sconvert

Conquest.description: Deletes the settlement that matches the provided identifier.
Conquest.name: delsettlement

Core.description: Loads modules into the bot application.
Core.help: The module file needs to be present in the modules folder of the bot.
Core.name: load

Core.description: Unloads modules from the bot application.
Core.help: The module file needs to be present in the modules folder of the bot.
Core.name: unload

Core.description: Reloads modules loaded into the bot application.
Core.help: The module file needs to be present in the modules folder of the bot.
Core.name: reload

Core.description: Displays all loaded modules.
Core.name: modules

Core.description: Enables the target cog/module on the server where the command was executed.
Core.name: modules enable

Core.description: Disables the target cog/module on the server where the command was executed.
Core.name: modules disable

Core.description: Reveals a hidden module from the list of loaded modules.
Core.name: modules unhide

Core.description: Hides a module from the list of loaded modules.
Core.name: modules hide

Core.description: Displays all commands in a given module
Core.name: commands

Core.description: Enables a command for the server where the command was executed in.
Core.name: commands enable

Core.description: Disables a command for the server where the command was executed in.
Core.name: commands disable

Core.description: Returns the target individual's Discord ID.
Core.help: If no user is provided with the command, the bot will use the user who executed it.
Core.name: userid

Core.description: Returns the server's ID for the server the command was typed in.
Core.name: serverid

Core.description: Returns the channel's ID for the channel the command was typed in.
Core.name: channelid

Core.description: Returns the target role's ID for the server the command was typed in.
Core.name: roleid

Core.description: Politely kicks the bot off your server.
Core.name: remove

Core.description: Returns the latencies (in miliseconds) for every active shard.
Core.name: latencies

Core.description: Changes the name of the bot.
Core.name: setname

Core.description: Changes the bot's status. (Online by default)
Core.help: This command requires one argument and it needs to be one of the following: `online, offline, idle, dnd, invisible`
Core.name: setstatus

Core.description: Changes the bot's activity
Core.help: This command requires two arguments: the type of activity (playing, listening, watching) and the message itself.
Core.name: setactivity

Core.description: Starts an automatic bot activity rotation.
Core.name: setactivity stats

Core.description: Stops the automatic bot activity rotation.
Core.name: setactivity stats stop

Core.description: Restarts the bot
Core.name: restart

Core.description: Shutdowns the bot
Core.name: shutdown

Core.description: Shows general information about the translation of the bot.
Core.name: translate

Core.description: Exports various bot data into a file.
Core.help:
**Available export functions:**
• **commands** = Exports command metadata into a JSON file.
Core.name: export

Core.description: Exports all command metadata into a JSON file. The target file is saved in the folder 'exports'.
Core.name: export commands

Dictionaries.description: Returns a list of definitions based on the term you parse to the bot.
Dictionaries.help: This command supports only **English words & phrases**
Dictionaries.name: dict

Dictionaries.description: Returns a list of the top synonyms from Thesaurus based on the term you parse to the bot.
Dictionaries.help: This command supports only **English words & phrases**
Dictionaries.name: synonym

Dictionaries.description: Returns a list of the top antonyms from Thesaurus based on the term you parse to the bot.
Dictionaries.help: This command supports only **English words & phrases**
Dictionaries.name: antonym

Dictionaries.description: Returns the top urban dictionary definition based on the term you parse to the bot.
Dictionaries.help: This command supports only **English words & phrases**
Dictionaries.name: urbandict

Economy.description: Lets you claim a set sum of money on a daily basis.
Economy.help: If you wish to gift your daily reward instead of claiming it for yourself, you can mention the individual when using the command.
Economy.name: daily

Economy.description: Displays the sum of money the target individual has on their profile.
Economy.help: If no user is provided with the command, the bot will display the sum of money that you have on your profile.
Economy.name: currency

Economy.description: Awards/Subtracts a set amount of money to/from the target individual.
Economy.name: adjust

Economy.description: Transfers a set amount of money to another user.
Economy.name: give

Economy.description: Lets you bet a certain amount of money on a roll between 1 and 100.
Economy.name: roulette

Economy.description: Giveaway command group. Please refer to `giveaway start` and `giveaway end` for more information.
Economy.name: giveaway

Economy.description: Starts a currency giveaway. Users can claim their reward by reacting to the bot message.
Economy.name: giveaway start

Economy.description: Ends a giveaway by a provided bot message ID
Economy.name: giveaway end

Moderation.description: Deletes a set number of messages.
Moderation.help:
**Available filters:**
• **bot/bots** = Deletes only bot messages.
• **me/author** = Deletes only the command author's messages.
• **embed/embeds** = Deletes only embeds.
• **file/attachment** = Deletes only file attachments.
• **user/member <@somebody>** = Deletes only the specified user's messages.
• **has <text>** = Deletes all messages that contain the provided bit of text.
• **regex <regex>** = Deletes only messages that match the provided regular expression.
Moderation.name: purge

Moderation.description: Kicks the mentioned individual for the provided reason. (Optional)
Moderation.name: kick

Moderation.description: Bans the mentioned individual for the provided reason and time length. (Optional)
Moderation.help:
- This command accepts the following time units:
`m(inutes), h(ours), d(ays), w(eeks)`
*If no time unit is specified, the input defaults to minutes.*
Moderation.name: ban

Moderation.description: Unbans the target individual from the server.
Moderation.help: Since the target individual can not be mentioned directly within the server, a **<username>#<discriminator>** or a **User ID** should be provided.
Moderation.name: unban

Moderation.description: Soft bans the mentioned individual for the provided reason. (Optional)
Moderation.help: Soft bans in essence kick the target individual from the server while deleting their messages. It's not the same as a normal ban.
Moderation.name: softban

Moderation.description: Mutes the target individual from chatting on the server for a provided time period. (Optional)
Moderation.help:
This command accepts the following time units:
`m(inutes), h(ours), d(ays), w(eeks)`
*If no time unit is specified, the input defaults to minutes.*
Moderation.name: mute

Moderation.description: Unmutes the target individual if they were previously muted using the bot.
Moderation.name: unmute

Moderation.description: Sets a chatting cooldown for the channel where the command was used.
Moderation.help: This command accepts the following time units: `s(econds), m(inutes), h(ours)`
Moderation.name: slowmode

Moderation.description: Disables slowmode for the channel where the command was used.
Moderation.name: slowmode disable

Moderation.description: Reports the target user for a particular reason.
Moderation.help:
- A report reason must be provided in order to use this command.
- This command will only work when a report channel is set. (Disabled by default)
Moderation.name: report

Moderation.description: Selects a text channel where future user reports are going to be sent.
Moderation.help: Using this command will enable user reports if they were previously disabled. (Disabled by default)
Moderation.name: report setchannel

Moderation.description: Disables user reporting for the server where the command was used.
Moderation.name: report disable

Moderation.description: Warns the target user for a particular reason. As a result, this individual will receive a direct message from the bot.
Moderation.name: warn

Moderation.description: Displays a list of warnings for the target individual.
Moderation.help: You can navigate through pages by providing a page number after the username.
Moderation.name: warnings

Moderation.description: Resets all warnings for the target individual.
Moderation.name: warnings reset

Moderation.description: Deletes a specific warning that was issued to the target individual.
Moderation.name: warnings delete

Moderation.description: Changes the number of warnings needed for a user to trigger an automatic mute/kick/ban from the server. (Disabled by default)
Moderation.help:
- Using this command will enable the above-mentioned automatic actions if previously disabled.
- If any of the number of warnings match for mute, kick or ban, the following will take priority from highest to lowest: ban > kick > mute.
Moderation.name: warnings auto

Moderation.description: Disables the target automatic action from triggering for future user warnings.
Moderation.name: warnings auto disable

Moderation.description: Blacklists the target user. As a result, they will no longer be able to use the bot in that server. If the target user is already blacklisted, they will get removed from the blacklist and regain access to bot commands.
Moderation.name: blacklist

Moderation.description: Blacklists the target user. As a result, they will no longer be able to use the bot in that server.
Moderation.name: blacklist add

Moderation.description: Removes the target user from the bot blacklist. As a result, they will regain access to the bot's commands in that server.
Moderation.name: blacklist remove

Moderation.description: Moves all moderation action messages to a separate channel.
Moderation.name: modlog

Moderation.description: Restores the modlog channel settings back to default. As a result, future moderation actions will be displayed in the channel where the command was executed.
Moderation.name: modlog default

Moderation.description: Displays the newest members of your server.
Moderation.help: A maximum of 20 users can be displayed at once.
Moderation.name: lastjoined

Profiles.description: Displays the profile of the target user.
Profiles.help: If you do not specify a user, the bot will display your profile.
Profiles.name: profile

Profiles.description: Sets (or resets) your profile's biography paragraph to the provided text.
Profiles.help: If you wish to reset your biography paragraph, provide no text to the command.
Profiles.name: bio

Profiles.description: Provides further information about all available profile backgrounds.
Profiles.help:
- Providing a number will display a preview of the profile background.
- Providing a category will display all available backgrounds within that category.
Profiles.name: background

Profiles.description: Equips a profile background for the server where the command was executed.
Profiles.help: If you are not sure which profile backgrounds you own, you can view them by using one of the bot's commands to display your profile background inventory.
Profiles.name: background equip

Profiles.description: Changes your profile background back to default.
Profiles.name: background unequip

Profiles.description: Purchases a profile background from the shop for its' corresponding price
Profiles.help: All bought backgrounds are stored in your inventory and can be used cross-server. You only need to buy it once.
Profiles.name: background buy

Profiles.description: Shows all profile backgrounds you currently own.
Profiles.help: Profile background purchases are global and can be used cross-server.
Profiles.name: background inventory

Profiles.description: Toggles (enables/disables) experience gain and leveling on your server.
Profiles.name: leveling

Profiles.description: Enables experience gain and leveling on your server.
Profiles.name: leveling enable

Profiles.description: Disables experience gain and leveling on your server.
Profiles.name: leveling disable

Profiles.description: Resets experience and level progression for all users on your server back to 0.
Profiles.name: leveling reset

Settings.description: Resets all server bot settings back to default. Be careful, this action is irreversible.
Settings.name: settings reset

Settings.description: Returns a list of locally detected language(localization) packages
Settings.name: languages

Settings.description: Changes the language of the bot
Settings.name: langset

Settings.description: Shows or changes the bot's prefix on the server.
Settings.help: If you do not include a new prefix, the command will instead display the bot's current prefix on the server.
Settings.name: prefix

Settings.description: Shows the bot's prefix on the server.
Settings.name: prefix show

Settings.description: Resets the bot's prefix on the server back to default.
Settings.name: prefix reset

Utility.help: If no user is provided with the command, the bot will instead return your avatar.
Utility.name: avatar

Utility.description: Rolls a number in a given range.
Utility.help: If no number is provided with the command, the bot will roll a number between 1 and 100.
Utility.name: roll

Utility.description: Shows the target individual's user information.
Utility.help: If no user is provided with the command, the bot will return your information instead.
Utility.name: userinfo

Utility.description: Displays general information about the bot.
Utility.help: Server bot latency is directly tied to which shard your server is placed in.
Utility.name: botinfo

Utility.description: Returns an answer for a yes or no question.
Utility.name: 8ball

Utility.description: Picks a random item from a provided list of items, separated by a semicolon.
Utility.name: choose

Utility.description: Changes the nickname of all mentioned individuals
Utility.name: massnick
